an5.153:1.1: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
an5.153:1.3: They listen to the teaching bent only on putting it down. They listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They’re antagonistic to the teacher, planning to attack them. They’re witless, dull, and stupid. And they think they know what they don’t know.
an5.153:1.4: Someone with these five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
an5.153:2.1: Someone with five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.
an5.153:2.3: They don’t listen to the teaching bent only on putting it down. They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They’re not antagonistic to the teacher, and not planning to attack them. They’re wise, bright, and clever. And they don’t think they know what they don’t know.
an5.153:2.4: Someone with these five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
